article_title: The Phone That's Failing Apple: iPhone XR
short_description: Apple’s cheapest new iPhone, the XR, has fallen far short of Apple’s expectations, forcing the company to reduce production drastically and cutting into its revenue projections.

article_title: Jeff Bezos and Jamie Dimon: Best of Frenemies
short_description: The JPMorgan chief and Amazon founder have found their companies’ fortunes increasingly entwined, but the balance of power between their firms has shifted.

article_title: China Lands Probe on the 'Dark Side' of the Moon
short_description: China successfully landed a probe on the far side of the moon, marking a milestone for the country’s ambitious space program and heating up competition with the U.S.

article_title: Marriott Says Hackers Swiped Millions of Passport Numbers
short_description: Marriott said fewer customers were affected in a massive data breach than initially feared but that hackers had compromised the passport numbers of millions of people.

article_title: Massive Leak Strikes Germany's Political Class
short_description: German authorities were investigating the leak of private data belonging to hundreds of politicians in one of the country’s largest cyber leaks.
Hester Peirce, a Republican member of the SEC with libertarian leanings, has won fans in the cryptocurrency community with her approach to regulating the market.

article_title: Judge Blocks Airbnb Crackdown in New York City
short_description: A federal judge blocked a New York City law intended to curb Airbnb, giving a boost to the company and others that offer short-term rentals in the city.

article_title: Blood Pressure, Baby's Pulse, Sperm Potency: Home Health Devices Are Tracking More Than Ever
short_description: On display at the 2019 CES show will be wristbands that check blood pressure, a forehead sleep sensor that detects if you stop breathing and a band for a woman’s stomach that tracks an unborn baby’s heart rate. But how will the makers of these devices handle all the collected data about our bodies?

article_title: Your Ice Cream Will Ride in a Self-Driving Car Before You Do
short_description: Moving a few pounds of stuff to people turns out to be much easier than getting large, impatient and litigious human beings to their destinations.

article_title: How'd You Get That Job? Questions for a User Experience Researcher at Pinterest
short_description: Larkin Brown, who studies how and why people use the social-media site, describes her role and how she got there in a new Wall Street Journal column that explores today’s career paths.

Videogame retailer GameStop is working to restructure its business as it searches for its fifth chief executive in a little over a year. But some say that to stay in the game, the retailer might be better off selling itself.

article_title: Amazon, to Win in Booming Rural India, Reinvents Itself
short_description: The retailer is targeting hundreds of millions of new online shoppers in India’s countryside by simplifying its order screen with Hindi and videos, opening stores to help people shop and adding a fleet of local deliverymen who can take payments.

article_title: Comedian Paul Scheer on the Most Interactive Way to Watch Basketball
short_description: The host of the ‘How Did This Get Made’ podcast details his quest for the perfect backpack and the best way for stat nerds to obsess over NBA games.

article_title: Square Chooses Blizzard Entertainment Executive to be New CFO
short_description: Square said Amrita Ahuja will join the financial-technology company as chief financial officer starting later this month.

article_title: The Future of Everything's 10 Best Stories of 2018
short_description: From a flying-car test drive to the woolly mammoth’s potential return, our favorite stories from the past 12 months.
